page.title: 14A FORMER HEADMISTRESS
page.content: Living near Broadwas C.E.School is a former Headmistress. She took up her post in January 1941 and retired in August 1972.She succeeded a Headmistress who had been at the school since 1906! When she first came there were about 40 children in the school and over the years the number rose to about 120 which included some 20 children who were evacuated from Birmingham during the war period. Several extentions were carried out to cater for this increase which was due mainly to a rise in the birthrate and the closure of the small school at Knightwick.The school teaching staff then rose to four. Most of the children came from Broadwas but some travelled from Knightwick and Cotheridge in a coach, on bicycles and even on foot.
